titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Secretary of the University of Pittsburgh, Barbara Jean Ferketish, Legacy Project Files, 2005 UA.3.4.1A.2006
titlestmt.author: Steve Tehovnik and Marianne Kasica.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:52:00 -0400.

did.unittitle: Secretary of the University of Pittsburgh, Barbara Jean Ferketish, Legacy Project Files
did.abstract: The Legacy Project was conducted by the Office of the Secretary of the University of Pittsburgh. Its purpose was to identify key people and events and illustrate the University's mission and sucess. This information was gathered for inclusion in an interactive display kiosk located in Alumni Hall.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Steve Tehovnik and Marianne Kasica in March 2012.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Secretary of the University of Pittsburgh, Barbara Jean Ferketish, Legacy Project Files, 2005, UA 3.4.1A.2006, University Archives, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Secretary of the University of Pittsburgh, Barbara Jean Ferketish, Legacy Project Files, 2005, UA 3.4.1A.2006, University Archives, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Legacy Project files are an inclusive collection of the research, photographs, and biographies that identified key people, events and sucesses of the University of Pittsburgh. Beginning with overviews in various areas of study and living, the collection is largely comprised of both used and unused research on Pitt connected persons and their acomplishments. The display was completed in 2005.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Deposited in the University Archives by Jean Ferketisch, Secretary of the University, in Spring of 2006.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: All rights reserved. University of Pittsburgh.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Discovering subseries documents the members of the Pitt community that have been elected to one of the National Academies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Living subseries documents the non academic activities of the Pitt community.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Learning subseries documents the exceptional programs and scholarships the Pitt students have been participating in.

did.unittitle: Writing, Truman and Udall Scholarship, Marshall Scholarship

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Remembering subseries documents the built environment and institutions that Pitt is known for.

did.unittitle: Cathedral of Learning, Heinz Chapel, Buildings, Medical History

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Serving subseries documents the public and community service that Pitt is involved in.

did.unittitle: Community Outreach, COPC, Shakespeare in School, Center for Minority Health and Institute of Politics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Students subseries features some prominent student achievements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Timeline subseries illustrates the development of the Pitt historical timeline for the project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Legacy Directory subseries describes the structure and content of the kiosk project.

did.unittitle: Pitt Legacy Directory Kiosk Introductory Pages, Schedule, Correspondence, Notes, Storyboard, and Touchscreen User Guide
Varsity Letter Club Awardees of Distinction
National Academy of Sciences, Institute of Medicine, National Academy of Engineering
Legacy Gallery, the Pitt Experience profile research files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Legacy Gallery documents the people featured in the kiosk project.

did.unittitle: Legacy Gallery, the Pitt Experience unused profile research files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents the people not yet included in the kiosk project.
